result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  COURT AMENDED THE DTC/DPA TO REFLECT COUNT 1: MISDEMEANOR RETAIL THEFT.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is rescheduled to 01-27-2016 at 02:30pm.  sdg

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has been accepted into Drug Treatment Court but continues to wait on space to become available.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Gabriela Leija is not available today.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Pick n Saves
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
